intro: Alsodeiopsis mannii, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by small, round, woody fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
